revised_title: Morphological Identification of Photoreceptors in Larval Tiger Salamander Retina
tldr: The article identifies six types of photoreceptors in the larval tiger salamander retina using electron microscopy. These types include red rods, green rods, double cones with principal and accessory members, large single cones, and small single cones. The study provides a detailed description of the morphological and cytological characteristics of each photoreceptor type, as well as their interconnections through gap junctions.
